programmes.show_description: Left Field: Alun Armstrong and Amanda Redman star in the hugely popular mystery series. A recently paroled prisoner confesses to the abduction of a child 25 years previously.
Unnatural Causes: At the Great Slaughter Mangold Wurzel Festival, the body of a woman is discovered stuffed in the Aunt Sally. Cause of death: Asphyxiation by sawdust in the lucky dip.
Substitute: More laughs with the Chigwell sisters. Tracey finds herself attracted to another man for the first time since her husband went to prison.
Murder in the Dark: Final Chapter: With Beth named a suspect after another killing, Mattie races to solve the case and clear her aunt's name.
Shopping from Home.
Shopping from Home.
The Happiest Family: During a wholesome weekend away with the sisters, a former colleague of Sister Reg is found dead in her bed. Sister Boniface endeavours to uncover the killer.
The Three Sergeants: Ackland, Boyden and Cryer are at each other's throats over the death of a prisoner in custody.
Trade Off: Beech pulls rank when Glaze arrests one of his informants, and they agree on a deal which Glaze lives to regret.
Treading Water: An unhappy Jim Carver is offered a ticket out of Sun Hill - but will he take it?
Look Again: Poor old Reg Hollis faces tragedy when he uncovers a protection racket on a housing estate.
Love and War: Part 1: Garfield is anxious to know where he stands with Jenny. Quinnan is behaving strangely, and seems to have something to hide.
The thorny subject of the contraceptive pill causes controversy, with Dr Turner's support putting him at odds with some of his more traditional colleagues.
Dr Turner realises he may have helped to cause the rise in birth deformities. Sister Evangelina's health continues to deteriorate and a bride goes into labour.
Epic dramatisation of Catherine Cookson's thriller, set in 19th-century Tyneside. Freddie Musgrave seems to have it all, until his past returns to haunt him.
Conclusion of the two-part festive special in which Caroline tells Gillian the truth about why she had to take the new headship.
The Happiest Family: During a wholesome weekend away with the sisters, a former colleague of Sister Reg is found dead in her bed. Sister Boniface endeavours to uncover the killer.
Squaring the Circle: Emilia Fox stars in a feature-length forensics drama. Nikki and Jack work with young DI Sarah Parks to ascertain the identity of a dead hitman.
British character actor Alun Armstrong stars in the hit cop series featuring a veteran detective team. A desperate Halford visits a clairvoyant hoping to talk to his wife.
The thorny subject of the contraceptive pill causes controversy, with Dr Turner's support putting him at odds with some of his more traditional colleagues.
Scheissfeld: Miep and Jan's marriage is tested when he ignores her plea to abandon a dangerous mission. After the Nazis suffer a huge blow at the hands of The Resistance, Jan hides.
Aileen Aroon: More corpses of young men are found, while other teens continue to disappear, and Corcoran leaves no stone unturned in his search for answers.
Shopping from Home.
Shopping from Home.
You Pays Yer Money: Sharon isn't registered to vote in Chigwell, but when election fever hits the constituency, she wants to make use of Darryl's vote.
Love and War: Part 2: Quinnan's secret comes out, dividing Sun Hill. Crime fighting takes a back seat as Quinnan and Garfield clash.
New. Hopelessly Devoted: Michelle helps a patient with rheumatoid arthritis who suspects her partner may be cheating on her and Joe confronts Daniel over his suspicious behaviour.
New. Out With the Bath Water: Melody forces a man to face the issues he has with fatherhood and Lionel poses an important question to Vivien.
Protection: Ed's father collapses while working in the hospital canteen and Ric moves out of Jess and Lisa's flat. Mubbs struggles to adjust to Rosie and her children living with him.
Making Other Plans: Adam finally forgives himself for Harry's death following an encounter with psychopathic prisoner Jackson.
Love and War: Part 2: Quinnan's secret comes out, dividing Sun Hill. Crime fighting takes a back seat as Quinnan and Garfield clash.
New. As Pat fights for her life in hospital, fingers begin to point at Janine - will she come clean? Max has exciting news for Bradley, and Ronnie lets Roxy in on her secret.
New. As Roxy plans her father's funeral, she discovers shocking news; will she ever be able to forgive Peggy? Janine has trouble at the police station, and Syed returns.
Big Steps and Little Uns: A voyage back in time to a more innocent age to meet the Yorkshire vets. Siegfried, James and Tristan deal with domestic disharmony in their own ways.
Amanda's father confronts Leo, Charles waits anxiously for Avril to recover, and Ken basks smugly in the glory of having avoided suspicion for the theft of Jan's designs.
No More Cakes and Ale: In a race against the clock, Frank and Lu must track down a vital witness in a crown court trial.
Poetic Justice: Fletcher is incensed when a third cellmate arrives - and turns out to be an old enemy. But why is everyone so polite to him? Includes strong language.
Who's That with Barry and Glenda? - It's Not Barry and Glenda: Classic comedy. Truly reckons Barry is up to something sinister - why else would he be in the woods with a suitcase?
An Apple a Day: The long running sitcom that first graced our screens in 1973. Clegg, Truly and Alvin reluctantly agree to go to a remote farm and take some old-timers out for a day.
Barry Becomes a Psychopathic Killer but Only Part Time: Roy Clarke's classic sitcom. Truly helps Smiler when he's pursued by a woman who thinks he's rich.
Hard-Gating: Martin Shaw is the tough but very fair High Court Judge tackling another mystery. A prison inmate is found dead in his cell, seemingly killed by his cell mate.
British character actor Alun Armstrong stars in the hit cop series featuring a veteran detective team. A desperate Halford visits a clairvoyant hoping to talk to his wife.
